examples: You know, he’s a little inarticulate.
words.defineEn: (of people) unable to express oneself clearly or easily
words.defineVi: (của người) không thể thể hiện bản thân một cách rõ ràng hoặc dễ dàng

examples: and I look like *inaudible* Rikki: You're becoming that person.

I think that (inaudible).
words.defineEn: impossible to hear; imperceptible by the ear
words.defineVi: không thể nghe được; không thể nghe thấy bằng tai

words.defineEn: not elegant or graceful in expression
words.defineVi: không thanh lịch hoặc duyên dáng trong biểu hiện

words.defineEn: marked by ill omens or signs, especially of future misfortune or failure
words.defineVi: được đánh dấu bởi những điềm báo hoặc dấu hiệu xấu, đặc biệt là sự bất hạnh hoặc thất bại trong tương lai

examples: So it could be incessant throat clearing or pin clicking.
words.defineEn: happening or continuing without interruption or stopping
words.defineVi: xảy ra hoặc tiếp tục mà không bị gián đoạn hoặc dừng lại

examples: Yet once again, the Roeblings proved indomitable.
But mortal guards and ordinary weapons wouldn’t suffice, so the visionary god devised an indomitable new defender.
The same huge size that makes bluefin tuna indomitable in the ocean has made them vulnerable to one predator in particular: us.
Wickliffe was the leader of the virulent pro-slavery movement.
In particularly virulent cases, this damage can be lethal.
But it wasn’t a virulent flu or poorly-chosen mushrooms that caused their deaths.
Fortunately, while Ebola is highly virulent, several factors limit its contagiousness.
It wasn't particularly virulent, so that the number of deaths in 2009 among the general population was even less than a regular seasonal flu, even though there were many, many more infections.
words.defineEn: extremely poisonous or injurious; producing venom
words.defineVi: cực độc hoặc gây thương tích; sản xuất nọc độc

examples: It doesn't seem at all to have any impact on the virulence or what we call the deadliness of the virus.
words.defineEn: extreme harmfulness (as the capacity of a microorganism to cause disease)
words.defineVi: cực kỳ có hại (như khả năng gây bệnh của một vi sinh vật)

examples: Ben Franklin, he passed out pamphlets.
But then along came Thomas Paine’s pamphlet Common Sense.
Should I get you a pamphlet?
The next method is collecting free items like pamphlets and flyers.
Should it open like a pamphlet?
words.defineEn: a small book with a paper cover giving information about a particular subject
words.defineVi: một cuốn sách nhỏ có bìa giấy cung cấp thông tin về một chủ đề cụ thể

examples: And that's especially true if you focus on the idea of liberty, as many of the pamphleteers did.
words.defineEn: someone who writes pamphlets, especially one who promotes partisan views on political issues
words.defineVi: một người viết sách nhỏ, đặc biệt là một người thúc đẩy quan điểm đảng phái về các vấn đề chính trị

examples: We have ample supply now.
A number of incidents over the years have provided ample reason for worry.
The leaves use the ample sunlight up there to create sugars through photosynthesis.
However, there is ample cause for hope.
But there's ample reason to be optimistic that we'll get there.
words.defineEn: more than enough in size or scope or capacity
words.defineVi: quá đủ về quy mô hoặc phạm vi hoặc năng lực

examples: So the amplitude is 1/2.
Greater amplitude means higher intensity, means brighter color.
This noise has two basic qualities: phase and amplitude.
Sounds can be represented as the amplitudes of the sound wave.
Wave height, or amplitude, determine a sound's loudness, which we typically measure in decibels.
words.defineEn: (physics) the maximum displacement of a periodic wave
words.defineVi: (vật lý) độ dịch chuyển cực đại của một sóng tuần hoàn

examples: And that skepticism, to be blunt, has been very amply rewarded.
He's always had people protecting HIM from his mistakes or from people who would try to hold him to ACCOUNT, and he's always been amply FINANCED.
words.defineEn: to an ample degree or in an ample manner
words.defineVi: ở một mức độ phong phú hoặc trong một cách phong phú

examples: It is a fundamental tenet of our foreign policy and has been for quite some time, until recently, when the new administration sort of disclaimed that view to some extent.
words.defineVi: tuyên bố từ chối trách nhiệm về

examples: Usually eight to twelve hours later, the skin in those areas is discolored by livor mortis, or post-mortem stain.

Despite the kiln's large capacity, many lamps get broken or discolored.

examples: Disconnect the pipe leading from the top of the water tank.
The evening is a time to disconnect from technology.
They let themselves go during the weekend getaway, enjoying leisurely activities, disconnecting from work, and prioritizing their relaxation.
Personal failures, disconnect from friends, and academic disappointments casted a cloud on my sense of purpose.
The country was largely disconnected.
words.defineVi: ngắt kết nối, disjoin hoặc unfasten

words.defineEn: doing something secretly in an attempt to avoid notice
words.defineVi: làm điều gì đó bí mật trong một nỗ lực để tránh thông báo

examples: Well, in some respects, he does things surreptitiously with his intelligence services, but also, I think he likes to try to intimidate his foes.
They appear to be, for instance, independent, but they are in fact coordinated surreptitiously by one particular actor in the background.
It just happened more surreptitiously, often carried out in such a way that did not look like enslavement.

So the decision, for example, by the Kremlin to publish this surreptitiously recorded phone call between Victoria Nuland, a State Department official, and the U.S. ambassador to Ukraine, I don't think the Kremlin saw that as a kind of great breach, as if the Kremlin was entering into some new phase of international relations, new phase of information warfare.
